summary.para: Discovers the MDM service. The discovery process uses the [MS-MDE]: Mobile Device Enrollment Protocol

param.name: pszUPN
param.para: Address of a NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the user principal name (UPN) of the user requesting registration.

param.name: ppMgmtInfo
param.para: Address of a
structure that contains pointers to the URIs of the management and authentication services.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Discovers the MDM service using a candidate server. The discovery process uses the [MS-MDE]: Mobile Device Enrollment Protocol

param.name: pszUPN
param.para: Address of a NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the user principal name (UPN) of the user requesting registration.

param.name: pszDiscoveryServiceCandidate
param.para: Address of a NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the discovery service candidate to use in lieu of automatic discovery.

param.name: ppMgmtInfo
param.para: Address of a
structure that contains pointers to the URIs of the management and authentication services.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.
This function is not available before Windows Server 2012 R2 Update and Windows 8.1 Update.

summary.para: Gets the config info associated with the provider ID.

param.name: providerID
param.para: Type: _In_ PCWSTR
A string containing the provider ID.

param.name: configStringBufferLength
param.para: Type: _Inout_ DWORD*
A pointer to the buffer length (the size of configString in chars).

param.name: configString
param.para: Type: _Out_writes_to_opt_(*configStringBufferLength, *configStringBufferLength) PWSTR
A buffer which, if the function completes successfully, will contain the config info.

If the buffer isn't large enough to hold the data, then the function returns ERROR_MORE_DATA, and stores the required buffer size in the variable pointed to by configStringBufferLength. In that case, the contents of the configString buffer are undefined.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

param.name: DeviceInformationClass
param.para: Contains the maximum length that can be returned through the pszHyperlink
parameter.

param.name: ppDeviceRegistrationInfo
param.para: Details of the device registration.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. .

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Retrieves the management app hyperlink associated with the MDM service.

param.name: cchHyperlink
param.para: Contains the maximum length that can be returned through the pszHyperlink
parameter.

param.name: pszHyperlink
param.para: Address of a buffer that receives the NULL-terminated Unicode string with the hyperlink of the management app associated with the management service.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Checks whether the device is registered with an MDM service. If the device is registered, it also returns the user principal name (UPN) of the registered user.

param.name: pfIsDeviceRegisteredWithManagement
param.para: Address of a BOOL indicates whether the device is registered.

param.name: cchUPN
param.para: Contains the maximum length that can be returned through the pszUPN
parameter.

param.name: pszUPN
param.para: Optional address of a buffer that receives the NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the UPN of the user registered with the management service. If pszUPN is NULL then the BOOL pointed to by the pfIsDeviceRegisteredWithManagement parameter is updated to indicate whether the device is registered and the function returns ERROR_SUCCESS.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS and the BOOL pointed to by the pfIsDeviceRegisteredWithManagement parameter contains TRUE

or FALSE. If TRUE, the Unicode string pointed to by the pszUPN parameter contains the UPN of the registered user. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

If the buffer size indicated by the cchUPN parameter is too small then the call will fail with STRSAFE_E_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER but the BOOL pointed to by the pfIsDeviceRegisteredWithManagement parameter will be updated to indicate whether the device is registered.

summary.para: Checks whether MDM registration is allowed by local policy.

param.name: pfIsManagementRegistrationAllowed
param.para: Address of a BOOL that receives a value indication whether registration is allowed.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS and the BOOL pointed to by the pfIsManagementRegistrationAllowed parameter contains TRUE or FALSE. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Registers a device with a MDM service, using the [MS-MDE]: Mobile Device Enrollment Protocol.

param.name: pszUPN
param.para: Address of a NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the user principal name (UPN) of the user requesting the registration.
Windows 8.1: This parameter was located after the ppszMDMServiceUri parameter in Windows 8.1.

param.name: ppszMDMServiceUri
param.para: Address of a NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the URI of the MDM service.

param.name: ppzsAccessToken
param.para: Address of a NULL-terminated Unicode string containing a token acquired from a Secure Token Service which the management service will use to validate the user.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Registers a device with a MDM service, using Azure Active Directory (AAD) credentials.

param.name: UserToken
param.para: The User to impersonate when attempting to get AAD token

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Registers a device with a MDM service, using Azure Active Directory (AAD) device credentials.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

summary.para: Sets the config info associated with the provider ID.

param.name: providerID
param.para: Type: _In_ PCWSTR
A string containing the provider ID.

param.name: configString
param.para: Type: _In_ PCWSTR
A string containing containing the config info (the data to write).

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Indicates to the MDM agent that the device is managed externally and is not to be registered with an MDM service.

param.name: IsManagedExternally
param.para: If TRUE this device is not to be registered with an MDM service. If FALSE this device can be registered with an MDM service.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.

summary.para: Unregisters a device with the MDM service

param.name: RemoveEnterpriseData
param.para: TRUE if resources are to be removed during unregistration, FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is ERROR_SUCCESS. If the function fails, the returned value describes the error. Possible values include those listed at MDM Registration Error Values.

remarks.para: The caller of this function must be running as an elevated process.
